meanings.definition: Excessive pride in one's appearance or achievements.
meanings.sent1: Her vanities often made her overlook the feelings of others.
meanings.sent2: His vanities led him to constantly seek validation from others.
meanings.sent3: Despite his vanities, he couldn't hide his insecurities.
meanings.sent4: The castle of vanities crumbled when faced with reality.
meanings.sent5: The mirror reflected her vanities back at her, distorting the truth.

meanings.sent1: She placed her makeup neatly on the vanities in her room.
meanings.sent2: The antique vanities in the bedroom added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The vanities in the dressing room were adorned with delicate trinkets.
meanings.sent4: The vanities held memories of generations past, each with its own story.
meanings.sent5: The mirror on the vanities reflected her image like a still pond.

meanings.definition: The quality of being worthless or futile.
meanings.sent1: His pursuit of material vanities left him empty and dissatisfied.
meanings.sent2: The allure of fame and fortune often masks the vanities of life.
meanings.sent3: In the end, all his vanities amounted to nothing but dust.
meanings.sent4: The vanities of youth faded away as wisdom took their place.
meanings.sent5: The vanities of the world crumbled in the face of true love.
